text: : For the BSP politician, see Ravinder Kumar Molhu. Ravinder Kumar (1933 - 6 April 2001) was an Indian historian of Kashmiri descent He was for many years the Director of the Nehru Memorial Museum and Library in Delhi. He was also the Chairman of the Indian Council of Historical Research, New Delhi. ==Partial list of publications== *The Bombay Textile Strike, 1919 *The Leopard and the Tail *The Rowlatt Satyagraha in Lahore *From Swaraj to Purna Swaraj: Nationalist politics in the city of Bombay, 1920-32 ==References== ==Further reading== Biography on Ravinder Kumar Category:Historians of South Asia Category:Kashmiri people Category:1933 births Category:2001 deaths Category:20th-century Indian historians
